definition: A unit of sound or auditory sensation that is typically produced by vibrating objects and perceived by the human ear. It is commonly used to refer to the quality, pitch, or intensity of a sound, and can also denote a musical note or a specific sound frequency. Additionally, it can be used to describe the character or timbre of a voice or musical instrument.

examples.german: Sie hat einen guten Musikgeschmack, sie kennt sich mit verschiedenen Tönen aus.
examples.english: She has a good taste in music, she is familiar with different tones.

examples.german: Der Ton des Fernsehers ist zu leise.
examples.english: The volume of the television is too low.

examples.german: Die Töne der Geige klingen wunderschön.
examples.english: The sounds of the violin are beautiful.
He has a deep bass tone.
